meanings.definition: To convert an image into pixels.
meanings.sent1: I will pixellate the photo to make it clearer.
meanings.sent2: The camera automatically pixellates the image for online sharing.
meanings.sent3: When I tried to pixellate the picture, it turned into a funny mosaic.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed to pixellate into fragments as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a unique technique to pixellate the landscape, creating a stunning effect.

meanings.definition: To blur or distort an image by dividing it into pixels.
meanings.sent1: The software can pixellate the image to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent2: The old TV signal would sometimes pixellate during bad weather.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally pixellated my selfie, and now I look like a digital ghost.
meanings.sent4: His mind started to pixellate the memory, making it hard to recall clearly.
meanings.sent5: The emotions in the painting seemed to pixellate, adding a dreamlike quality to the artwork.
